offenses.message: Assignment Branch Condition size for initialize is too high. [30.55/15] (http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbcMetric)
Cyclomatic complexity for initialize is too high. [11/6]
Perceived complexity for initialize is too high. [13/7]
Useless assignment to variable - `message`. Use just operator `+`. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
Useless assignment to variable - `message`. Use just operator `+`. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
Extra empty line detected at method body beginning.
Unused method argument - `block`. If it's necessary, use `_` or `_block` as an argument name to indicate that it won't be used. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
Unused method argument - `block`. If it's necessary, use `_` or `_block` as an argument name to indicate that it won't be used. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)

Unused method argument - `inspect_proc`. If it's necessary, use `_` or `_inspect_proc` as an argument name to indicate that it won't be used. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
Extra empty line detected at method body end.
Assignment Branch Condition size for inspect_recursive is too high. [16.52/15] (http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbcMetric)
Useless assignment to variable - `ret`. Use just operator `+`. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
`end` at 201, 6 is not aligned with `if` at 197, 12.
Assignment Branch Condition size for assert_pre_conditions is too high. [26.08/15] (http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbcMetric)
Useless assignment to variable - `message`. Use just operator `+`. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
`end` at 247, 6 is not aligned with `case` at 242, 12.
Useless assignment to variable - `ret`. Use just operator `+`. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
Prefer single-quoted strings when you don't need string interpolation or special symbols. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#consistent-string-literals)
Freeze mutable objects assigned to constants.
Align the elements of an array literal if they span more than one line. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#align-multiline-arrays)
Freeze mutable objects assigned to constants.
Align the elements of an array literal if they span more than one line. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#align-multiline-arrays)

Unused method argument - `visit_proc`. If it's necessary, use `_` or `_visit_proc` as an argument name to indicate that it won't be used. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)

Unused method argument - `block`. If it's necessary, use `_` or `_block` as an argument name to indicate that it won't be used. You can also write as `each_and_index(*)` if you want the method to accept any arguments but don't care about them. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
Omit the parentheses in defs when the method doesn't accept any arguments. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#method-parens)

Unused method argument - `block`. If it's necessary, use `_` or `_block` as an argument name to indicate that it won't be used. You can also write as `map_pair(*)` if you want the method to accept any arguments but don't care about them. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
Omit the parentheses in defs when the method doesn't accept any arguments. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#method-parens)

Unused method argument - `block`. If it's necessary, use `_` or `_block` as an argument name to indicate that it won't be used. You can also write as `map_pair(*)` if you want the method to accept any arguments but don't care about them. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
Omit the parentheses in defs when the method doesn't accept any arguments. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#method-parens)

Unused method argument - `block`. If it's necessary, use `_` or `_block` as an argument name to indicate that it won't be used. You can also write as `merge_collisions(*)` if you want the method to accept any arguments but don't care about them. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#underscore-unused-vars)
Omit the parentheses in defs when the method doesn't accept any arguments. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#method-parens)
Omit the parentheses in defs when the method doesn't accept any arguments. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#method-parens)
Use a guard clause instead of wrapping the code inside a conditional expression. (https://github.com/bbatsov/ruby-style-guide#no-nested-conditionals)
